instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Hello,
I have a 14 inch Macbook Pro A2242. When put to charge via USB C i can see a very dim apple logo and it stays on for sometime and goes away and comes back on. I hear the chime too sometimes.

When checking with an Amp Meter it goes upto 20V and then the amp meter restarts after some seconds.

This is happening in the all 3 ports. (With Battery Disconnected).

PPBUS_AON is at 12.3V and cycling too because of the amp meter i guess.

Please help ho to proceed.

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
[Update] With the battery connected the Amp Meter does not reboot and draws a steady 2.5Amps.
Mouse Click is there. No Caps Key Light. No Chime. No Boot

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Do you still get dimmed apple logo?
Test for external video.

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Now the dim apple logo comes for about 2 seconds when i press the power button and goes away.
Nothing on the external display.

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Try DFU; revive, if still think to save some data.
Go for restore, if no data needed...

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101517, member: 682"]
Try DFU; revive, if still think to save some data.
Go for restore, if no data needed...
[/QUOTE]
Getting This ERROR

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: AC2 shows the target  machine in DFU, or Recovery?

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101533, member: 682"]
AC2 shows the target  machine in DFU, or Recovery?
[/QUOTE]
It shows in recovery. have to put it in dfu mode manually

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Any reason to quote an entire message, visible few centimeters above?
Please write directly into reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic.

Try again DFU restore with empty SoC ROM.
Don't forget to make a backup first.

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: What is Empty SoC ROM. I have no clue about this. Can you guide me please ?

threads.title: Macbook A2242 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Being M1 platform, is marked as SPI NOR (U2010); sorry for confusion.
Read it and make backup, then erase it and try DFU.
